blog.name: tiamat-zx
blog.title: Adam's CR Blog
blog.description: 32 years old, male, Critter, YouTuber, level 6 eldritch knight, video gamer, let's player, Vaxleth shipper, Critical Role fan, and just a guy wanting to voice his opinion.

summary: To Win by Losing, or To Lose By Winning? (CR2E53 Spoilers)
title: To Win by Losing, or To Lose By Winning? (CR2E53 Spoilers)
body:
Dairon had clearly lied to Beau and Jester about her whereabouts because she didn’t want Beau anywhere within Xhorhas: she didn’t want her pupil to die before it was time to act. That’s also why she joined the tavern fight. If Beau hadn’t gotten involved, she simply would’ve watched. It was risky and she could’ve had her cover blown, but better that than get her pupil killed.

And maybe that’s why Beau suddenly held back and lost; she realized and saw through Dairon’s disguise the moment she used similar techniques to their sparring matches during training. And she also noticed the Kryn in the tavern as well, no doubt hired by the overseer of the city, ready to detain/execute the spy. Even IF she won, she’d still lose. It clicked, and perhaps that’s why she LET herself lose. (Also a means to justify the loss being a better result.)

On a personal level, it sucked because that’s yet another loss on her count, and I know people will judge a lot based on statistics such as damage dealt/taken, kills, and critical wins/fails. And that practically everyone’s comparing it to Grog v. Kurn as if it was exactly the same result.

Except it’s NOT. Not even close.

Beau winning would’ve been WAY worse. Not just a loss of pride. But a loss of a teacher… and a friend. Whether she would rather suffer the loss of her pride or the loss of one cut from the same cloth… There’s no contest. Pride can be reclaimed by her own hands. Caduceus said there was a lesson for her to learn. Perhaps there was, but NOT the lesson either of them had in mind.

summary: i always gotta do some small studies of ‘new characters’ before i draw “LEGIT” stuff. gotta get a handle on facial features and...
caption:
i always gotta do some small studies of ‘new characters’ before i draw “LEGIT” stuff. gotta get a handle on facial features and all that jazz. >:l kickstarter to get a truck-load of books and just… gently back it up… dump it all on caleb. 

caleb, you’re an excellent excuse to learn how to draw cats, and i thank you for it.

➝ [ art only blog ] ● [ ko-fi ] ● [ instagram ] ღ

summary: Pikelan switch au where instead of Scanlan pining for Pike, it's Pike who falls head over heels for this charming music man who...
question: Pikelan switch au where instead of Scanlan pining for Pike, it's Pike who falls head over heels for this charming music man who sings them to sleep on rough nights and saunters onto battlefields with his only his words and a toothy grin and then she /dies/ and she isn't sure how to cope but somewhere in the back of her head is Scanlan's voice, telling her how much she means to him, begging her to come back and... Well, how could she refuse? [1]
answer:
But Scanlan doesn’t love her like she loves him. And then he finds out he has a kid??? And then he /dies/ and she confesses her love over a cold body, and hopes, prays that he’ll hear her like she heard him. And then he wakes up. And he leaves. And Pike doesn’t know what to do. She’d spent so much time ignoring her feelings that now all that’s left is an emptiness in her chest because in a way it was her own fault; if only she’d told him she cared for him the way she had. [2]

Pike thought she’d gotten over him. It’d been a year, and Scanlan saunters back into their lives like he’d never left (well, that’s not entirely true, but it was how Pike viewed it through her anger). She knows she has no right to be as angry as she does… but it doesn’t stop her from feeling hurt. But time goes on and those same butterfly feelings come back and she finds herself watching from a distance as Scanlan Shorthalt practically saves the whole goddamn world [3]

And then Vecna is banished. And they win. And Pike is grateful because now maybe she can move on… but, y'know, thats hard to do when the dashing bard himself is holding your hands and staring you right in the eyes with that same goddamn smile and then he opens his mouth and says “Pike… I hope this isn’t too forward but… I wondered if we could, y'know… get a drink or two?” and you better believe Pike very likely cries and nods her head and they share a kiss under the stars THE END [4/4]

i know pikelan day is long over now but i hope my very long au makes up for it hfjghdfsj (it ended up so long lmao im sorry)


do not apologize - this is beautiful! quality content that i can get behind!

Pike falls in love with his spirit, his strength of character, and how much he cares - especially because of how hard he tries to hide how much he does. she loves that he’s a bit rough around the edges, just like her.

and i like the potential that Scanlan did, in fact, love her the whole time

Pike: I never thought you’d feel the same

Scanlan: Are you kidding, Pikey Poo? I’ve loved you since the moment I first saw you

Pike: Then why didn’t you say anything? I mean…All those times I basically spelled it out for you…I literally told you that I loved you during your resurrection. You told me you heard me!

Scanlan:…Oh. I thought you meant, like…platonically.

Pike, through her tears: omg ur so dumb i love you

summary: Beau as a superhero in winter clothes/costume.
question: Beau as a superhero in winter clothes/costume.
answer: Beau as the Cobalt Soul, based on the Iron Fist. It’s a winter look cause the jumpsuit and vest is thicker and warmer than normal. She can’t wear sleeves or her powers are lost.

Fat queer of indeterminate origin.

Taliesin Jaffe is my boyfriend.

I love you.

#eyesnevershut
